page.title: 10SALTBURN STATION DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Saltburn's railway station has always been a central feature of the town and a major factor of its attractiveness. The station development began in 1982 and will be completed this year. The excursion platform to Brotton and Whitby and the Zetland Hotel platform had both been closed by 1970 and had become derelict. Land was bought by different groups of people and the site of the old platforms became a large supermarket and job centre the community needed. Old waiting rooms, toilets and ticket office were converted into shops which are now ready for occupation. The station front has been cleaned up and new buildings kept to their architectural style. The land adjoining the Zetland Hotel, once old stables, has been turned into flats to complete this new phase of development.(F.Duff.)
